video.title: Good Eats Collection
video.synopsis: Pop culture, comedy, and plain good eating: Host Alton Brown explores the origins of ingredients and presents food in fine and funny ways.

episodes.synopsis: Join Alton as he deconstructs the margarita and the Bloody Mary and reconstructs them with a deliciously classic formula.
episodes.title: American Classics VI: Raising the Bar Again

episodes.synopsis: Alton examines energy bars, which can be expensive and fattening, and demonstrates how to make ones that are nutritious, delicious and economical.
episodes.title: Power Trip

episodes.synopsis: Tired of sad, insipid waffles? Alton is determined to eradicate waffle boredom with the right equipment and the fluffiest, most flavorful batter.
episodes.title: The Waffle Truth

episodes.synopsis: Alton rescues the often-maligned meatball by demonstrating some unusual tips, such as combining a variety of meats and cooking in a mini-muffin pan.
episodes.title: Great Balls of Meat

episodes.synopsis: Alton investigates the versatile and healthy avocado and prepares a number of unusual dishes, including avocado ice cream and avocado cake frosting.
episodes.title: Curious Avocado Experiments

episodes.synopsis: There's nothing like a cocktail to liven up a party, and Alton demonstrates how to make the three classics that will make you the perfect host.
episodes.title: Raising the Bar

episodes.synopsis: Deprived of a trip to Thailand, Alton decides to master the art of making the perfect pad Thai with tofu and shows off his best stir-frying technique.
episodes.title: Your Pad or Mine

episodes.synopsis: To demonstrate the allure of aroma, Alton whips up some cinnamon rolls and reveals where most of the cinnamon sold in the U.S. comes from.
episodes.title: House of the Rising Bun

episodes.synopsis: Alton praises peaches, which are his favorite fruit. Best when purchased fresh from the farm, peaches are perfect for a variety of yummy desserts.
episodes.title: Peachy Keen

episodes.synopsis: Everyone loves popcorn, yet the usual fare at the movie theater is bland. Alton uncovers the best corn for the job and leaves no kernel unpopped.
episodes.title: Pop Culture

episodes.synopsis: Despite its strange appearance, the pomegranate figures into many delicious recipes, including a glaze for lamb, an unusual gelatin and cocktails.
episodes.title: Fruit 10 from Outer Space

episodes.synopsis: Alton breaks down the differences between Cajun and Creole cuisines and demonstrates the delicate procedure of making a foolproof roux for gumbo.
episodes.title: Bowl O' Bayou

episodes.synopsis: Alton delves into the makings of a great stew -- in this case, Hungarian goulash -- and explains the chemistry behind braising the right cut of meat.
episodes.title: Stew Romance

episodes.synopsis: The humble cucumber is the star of the show as Alton breaks down the pickling process and also makes deep-fried dill pickles and pickle popsicles.
episodes.title: Dill-icious

episodes.synopsis: After a ghostly visit from George Washington Carver, Alton investigates the four main varieties of peanuts in the U.S. and concocts some good eats.
episodes.title: Peanut Gallery

episodes.synopsis: Chicken wings are king as Alton prepares the most scrumptious of bar foods: spicy Buffalo chicken wings and sweet orange-glazed chicken wings.
episodes.title: The Wing and I

episodes.synopsis: Alton shows how to make two tasty pork dishes, grilled pork tenderloin and pork Wellington, as a low-fat alternative to chicken.
episodes.title: Tender Is the Pork

episodes.synopsis: Alton investigates the origins of spinach salad and offers valuable tips on everything from boiling eggs to choosing mushrooms and washing spinach.
episodes.title: American Classics I: Spinach Salad

episodes.synopsis: As Alton shows how to make a perfect crust with a mixture of apples for the filling, he discusses how different varieties of apples came to the U.S.
episodes.title: American Classics II: Apple Pie

episodes.synopsis: Alton relates the history of Creole red beans and rice, and insists that dried beans, not canned, are key to a successful interpretation of the dish.
episodes.title: American Classics III: Creole in a Bowl

episodes.synopsis: Although it's often thought of as an Italian dish, spaghetti with meat sauce is an American classic, and Alton shows how to prepare the ingredients.
episodes.title: American Classics IV: Spaghetti with Meat Sauce

episodes.synopsis: Though it has just four ingredients, the historically British pound cake relies largely on technique to achieve its famed delectable perfection.
episodes.title: American Classics V: A Pound of Cake

episodes.synopsis: Alton takes on the task of making chicken and dumplings, a dish that causes conflict due to the different ways its dumplings can be prepared.
episodes.title: American Classics VII: Don't Be Chicken of Dumplings

episodes.synopsis: Alton uses fresh tortillas, ground sirloin and tilapia to make tasty tacos, which traveled from south of the border to become American classics.
episodes.title: American Classics VIII: Tacos

episodes.synopsis: Alton delves into the history of the pumpkin, which was an invaluable staple for the pilgrims, and demonstrates how to bake pumpkin pies from scratch.
episodes.title: American Classics IX: Pumpkin Pie
